Reviews.Title: Finally,  a prepaid phone that rivals contract phones
Reviews.Author: B. Hall "bistro223"
Reviews.Content: For years people like me have been faced with terrible choices when it comes to prepaid phones.  You always have to pick from the "Blackberry look-a-likes", a flip phone,  or a really terrible touch screen phone.  Not anymore.  This phone is as good as higher priced contract models.  Sure it only comes with 2GB of internal memory instead of the 32GB iPhone or Galaxy,  but im not loading 1200 songs on my phone.  I dont need 200 apps on my phone. But even If you were to want to use this phone that way,  you can always load up the micro SD card which is 4GB from the factory,  but will accept a 32GB card. (sold seperately) I just want a phone that will get on the internet when I want it to,  load a YouTube video when I tell it to without buffering for 10 minutes,  and open apps like Angry Birds and Pandora quickly.  This phone does that beautifully.  I cannot say enough about the smoothness and quickness of the phone.  It runs on the famous Ice Cream Sandwich OS from Android,  which most any app is compatible with unlike a lot of the ones on Gingerbread.  anyway,  let me get to the pros and cons of the phone.Pros.1. Slick looking phone,  very flat, and sleek.  It sports a large screen, only 1/2 an inch smaller than the Galaxy S3.  The menu and back "buttons" at the bottom are not buttons at all, but rather are lights you just touch...just like the Galaxy S3. It has a home button in the middle at the bottom like an iPhone.  You aren't going to have to feel embarrassed busting out your prepaid phone with this model. It has a sophisticated, respectable look.2. Its fast.  When you move your finger to a command,  it does it.  Just like that,  no thinking,  no waiting.  Just pure seamless operation.  Thanks to its 1 GHz processor it can process commands with impressive speed.  Of course internet pages will load slightly slower than dealing with programs on your phone,  but its still very fast on the internet...even when not on WI-FI.  When on WI-FI it is almost as fast as the cable internet on my home computer.  On simple 3G it opens web pages as fast as a good DSL connection.3. Price.  At only 199.00 you are not going to find another phone that will perform like this one.  This phone performs like a model that costs twice as much.4. No contract.  You get all of the advantages of having a contract phone without the contract!  Sure Walmart now has the iPhone for sale on their Straight Talk plan,  but who wants to spend 700.00 on a phone? Not me,  if I could afford that,  I probably wouldn't be buying a prepaid phone in the first place.Cons1. Battery life.  the lifespan of this battery is pretty terrible actually.  Today,  I took it off the charger at 99% this morning (6:30a).  For some reason it will never say 100%.  Anyway,  by 10:00 am,  it was already down to 63%.  so I downloaded the Juice Defender app,  turned off wireless, and Bluetooth.  It seems to be conserving the battery a very noticeable amount more.  It went from sucking about 10% per hour,  (which is unacceptable to me) to about 4% per hour,  which isn't great, but I can deal with that. It would still be wise to invest in a backup battery somewhere along the way.2. Location of charge/usb plug.  The fact that the location of the charge/USB is on the bottom of the phone may be a plus to people that use a docking station.  I for one,  do not.  when I am in my car I may need to plug in my charger as well as my  3.5 mm AUX cable so I can hear Pandora in my car.  Well,  the 3.5 mm cable input is on the top,  while the charging input is on the bottom.  this causes the phone to sit sideways in its place on the seat,  which is a minor inconvenience for me.That's really all I have to say bad about the phone.  Don't spend 99.00 on a ZTE Merit, spend just 100 dollars more and be so much happier for the same monthly payment.  Just remember,  you only buy the phone once.  Monthly payments are the same with the 99.00 crap phone or the 700 dollar iPhone.  Dont pay 50 dollars a month for a phone that doesnt do what you expect/want/need it to do.

Reviews.Title: Having your cake and eating it too!
Reviews.Author: H.W.
Reviews.Content: Let me put it as simply as I can. If you are looking to combine the savings of a Net 10 prepaid plan with the reliability of Verizon coverage, look no further. This is the best phone that money can buy! As a Samsung Galaxy Nexus LTE owner, I can honestly say that I am hard pressed to find any noticeable difference in the performance between the two phones. There are also plenty of after market accessories for those of us who likes to personalize our phones. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic phone
Reviews.Author: Leah
Reviews.Content: I purchased this this phone about a month ago because I do not have any gsm service where I'm living.  This phone gets great reception, fast Internet and fast texting.  I have great service on the Verizon network, even though I'm a net 10 customer.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this phone when my older LG Optimus Extreme went swimming in the ocean.  I could not be happier with this phone.  I love that the camera on the back of the phone has a flash and I really enjoy the forward facing camera for skyping!  The processor on this phone is faster than most straight talk phone which is also a plus.  It has the 4.0 rather than 2.3 (big difference) and has the ice cream sandwich operating system. I have great coverage even though I live in the middle of nowhere as this phone goes through Verizon networks. If you're looking for a nice prepaid phone that wont break the bank and will save you money on your monthly bill, This is the one!  I looked at video and written reviews online before purchasing this phone and was unable to find any bad reviews.  I would recommend this phone to anyone I know.

Reviews.Title: "Like New" really was!
Reviews.Author: Phenixman "Roger"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this make and model as "like new".  I already knew that I liked this phone since I had one previously until I broke the screen.  This was a direct replacement and was in better shape than my previous one (even before I broke the screen).  I use a Tracfone service, StraightTalk from Walmart.  This phone was compatible with their service and uses the Verizon network.  At half the Verizon contract fee, I could not be happier!

Reviews.Title: LOVE this phone
Reviews.Author: Sharkstew "NewfieMom"
Reviews.Content: I have mine on Straight Talk / Verizon. My previous phone was an iphone 4 on AT&T.; I was very hesitant about buying this phone-I loved my iphone but the AT&T; service was beyond terrible.So I decided to try both this phone & prepaid. I couldn't be happier!The phone is responsive, fast, easy to use. The screen is a little bigger than the iphone 4. The camera is great-you can even just say "cheese" and it will snap the pic!I turned off the wifi so it runs strictly on the phone server. Never have any problem with websites or videos. So I'm saving gb's on my 10g home server limit. In fact I seldom use my laptop anymore.I truly am very happy with this phone and service. So glad I switched.  I don't get the stigma of having prepaid-look how much money I'm saving-the bill is always the same and I don't have to worry about limits on anything!

Reviews.Title: Champagne On A Beer Budget
Reviews.Author: Kevin Hersha
Reviews.Content: Has everything you would expect in a gee-whiz smart phone except for an indicator light. A solid phone on a solid network gives me champagne on a beer budget.

Reviews.Title: Great android tracphone!
Reviews.Author: C. Guevara
Reviews.Content: This phone is a huge improvement over my last LG pay-as-you-go phone. It is much faster than my previous LG model, has less dropped calls, extended coverage throughout the states even in small towns, and I have no issues using apps on this version e.g. picture freezing, random shut offs. Only thing to keep in mind though is that it doesnt seem to like live wallpapers. Whenever I have tried to use one, the home icons would take forever to load, so my advice is to keep it simple  and just use gallery pictures or downloaded wallpapers.

Reviews.Title: An Excellent Phone
Reviews.Author: Sara W
Reviews.Content: Thus far, all of my experiences with this phone have been great. For 200$, it's the best deal I've seen on the market. A close friend of mine got a new I-phone 5 for Christmas, and I've yet to see something the $700 phone could do that I couldn't manage on mine. The processor is very fast and I've never had service issues though I live a fairly rural area. Lots of storage space for apps and pictures. The camera isn't out of this world, but it isn't bad either- its about what I expected, and the flash is nice. Same for battery life- neither fantastic or horrible, just turn off extraneous services, (WiFi, Bluetooth, etc) when they're not in use. Overall a fantastic buy! (PS- I also bought the Blue Hardcover Case and screen protector- only $5.00- and it's helped my phone many a drop by my klutzy self.) Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: Good phone
Reviews.Author: PepeGraves "alfakilla"
Reviews.Content: This is a very good phone for the price. I'm not really in to the latest and greatest gadgets so, this phone is all that I need. My previous phone was a Nokia E5-00 that ran on the Symbian OS. I couldn't do much with it as far as apps and multimedia, so this is a huge upgrade for me. I'm enjoying the Android OS, its made handling my business a whole lot easier. I highly recommend it.... The only bad thing I have to say about it is the it's hard to see what's on the screen in the daylight and music playback is low volume.

Reviews.Title: Joined the 21st Century
Reviews.Author: Gregg K
Reviews.Content: Being older than 40 and not from the tech generation, or wanting to be tied into a contract and the cost, we simply had a little flip ph. with trac ph. Even though we couldn't get a signal at our house it was good for emergencies or calling when we were away from home. We don't live for our phone, so it sereved us pretty well. The criteria for going Hi-tech (Smartphone) was, 1- a signal from our home. (Even though we will keep our landline, like I said I am old school and I want it incase I need emergency response) Verizon was the only network that gave us that. 2- No contract. 3- Did I say no contract. So I did my reasearch and found that Net 10 had the best plan. $45.00 a month (on auto charge) and Verizon network. This ph. is great for some newbies like me and my wife. Even at work for me ( I work for the Forest Service and am remote, I get a signal) She can Skype with her family in Europe and text and everything a smartphone does. I'm even getting into the text thing. pretty cool to be able to touch bases without calling. I love some of the free apps apps I've found too. The Flashlight, the Googel Sky map that shows the stars (Freakin Cool)  and others. I know it can do a lot more, but I don't wnat to be obnoxious with it. We're not gamers and don't Fsacebook or twitter, but can see how any thing in the way of communicationg can be Done with this thing. For the $200+ we paid I know my wife can stay in touch with her family, she even takes her mom shopping with her useing Skype and showes her the beach etc.....I know there are more expensive phones out there that stand up and salutye when you turn it on, but this is perfect for us and lest us participate in the communication revolution. Highly recommend. Photos are great. speakers are a huge improvement over what we had and i'll end it here, cause I am so stupid when it comes to what these things do, that I don't know enough to know that I don't know anything.  Get it you'll love it. Also check out this web site. Educate youself.  It was a huge help in understanding how  contract phones and networks and how to get teh right ph. for your situation. [...]

Reviews.Title: First impressions...
Reviews.Author: spiritfox90
Reviews.Content: I got this phone yesterday. I haven't had a smart phone before, just a prepaid flip phone and that finally broke down. I always had the iPod touch and the iPad for the apps and I hated my old phone but I couldn't afford a "nice phone". At 45$ a month, this phone is a great cheap alternative to higher price smart phones. At first sight of this phone, it's very lightweight, but almost was slightly disappointing looking at it. It doesn't look very sturdy or durable especially comparing to my iPod touch, but I treat my electronics with care and I plan to get a cover for it. Turning it on however was a much better experience. Pretty screen. It's very fast, rivaling/surpassing my iPod touch for sure.  The thing I hate about apple is it upgrades and leaves their customers behind. I literally purchased my iPod touch 4 last fall, and the apps don't even work on it anymore since the upgraded to their new iOS, not even Facebook and everything is slow and crappy--- there goes 200$.  Hopefully android doesn't treat their customers the same way.  It has many apps to choose from in the google play store.... All of the ones offered from iTunes it seems... At least the popular ones. It has 4.0 ice cream sandwich which was why I selected it out of the price range phones that had 2.0 (yuck) or somewhere around there.The battery life is what concerns me the most. I got about 8 hours on it yesterday of continuous use. Because it has so many features it can be a battery sucker. I suppose the best way to counter this would maybe get a backup battery.Overall, pretty pleased with the phone. It works on verizon networks. For anyone griping about app crashes, there isn't a device that exists that doesn't crash once and a while.  My iPad does it, my iPod does it, my high price computer does it. It happens.Week 1:A lot of apps to choose from.  The phone runs them quickly and efficiently.  The wifi and 3G are quite fast.  Mind that the 3G is actually 2.5gb of data per month so I have tried to use the wifi as much as possible.  Videos load quickly, just as fast as any tablet.Camera (back facing one) is pretty decent at 5m.  Front facing one is pretty bad/lame but is usable for skype or other video messaging... for selfies, this is not the best camera.  It looks like an old webcam quality.To save battery from drainage, you can hold down the home screen button (the one in the middle) and swipe off the applications to close them down.Extendable storage with a micro SD card so you can load more multimedia stuff.  I'm not huge on that.  I use a few apps like snapchat, words with friends, pandora, bank app etc.  I would not use this phone to spend long hours on apps unless I am at home with the charger nearby.Conclusion:This phone works just as well as any expensive high priced phone.  The camera is decent and the phone is very responsive.  Screen is very nice and the device is very light weight.  Extendable storage, versatile with customization... you are able to move apps, add apps, there is a GPS, wifi works very well.  Nice sound quality (doesn't sound like surround sound but it's a phone, come on, let's be realistic.)  The weakest aspect of this phone is the battery life, just be mindful to charge and close down apps when not in use, also turn the push setting on the mail to off to retain some battery life.  Everything else seems great about it. Cheap but powerful.  I'd recommend this phone.

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: LAWRENCE THOMPSON
Reviews.Content: Awesome phone compared to the other smart phones! Great price, Not a big App person or facebook but does what is needed for my use!!

Reviews.Title: Great Value!
Reviews.Author: Alabuc
Reviews.Content: I've owned this phone for only a couple of weeks, and I've been very happy with it so far.  I bought the Straight Talk version and use that service.  This phone does everything I want, and quite well.  It is not "bleeding edge" when it comes to processor, Android version, and is not 4G; but, it also costs only about half to a quarter of the latest and greatest.  I'd hate to lose or break an $800 phone.Battery life is the main drawback.  I recharge it every night.From what other reviewers have said, it appears you have to buy the Tracfone/Straight Talk version if you want to use one of those services.  There is probably no real technical difference between the Net 10 and Tracfone/Straight Talk versions, but I guess Tracfone/Straight Talk won't activate the Net 10 version.

Reviews.Title: love this phone
Reviews.Author: Tara J Odegard
Reviews.Content: This phone has been great.  It has great speed and memory compared to other phones I was using and it is on the Verizon network.  For some reason it does not have the Navigator I have had on other phones including LG so I am going to look into this.  I was able to download a different one for free, but liked the one that came standard with other phones.

Reviews.Title: This was nothing but trouble for me.
Reviews.Author: Ed Moran
Reviews.Content: When I first got one of these via straight talk several months ago, it began to have "overheating" issues, and would stop charging at least once each time I had it plugged in. After a couple weeks it finally stopped doing that.However, immediately afterwards the phone would start randomly leaving me nasty messages telling me that removing the SD card without unmounting it first would cause data problems. I never removed it, but I did manage to lose priceless irreplaceable pictures of my first grandchild. Losing ALL media files became commonplace with this phone if I couldn't get to a computer to transfer files soon enough.The last event with this phone came just days ago when it was connected to a charger. The phone shut down and attempts to start the phone caused it to get so hot I had to remove the battery out of a literal concern over a fire starting.While the phone is still under warranty, I am debating what to do... do I hope it can be fixed? Or do I insist that the $200 I wasted on it be applied towards a better phone? It is not the first trouble-filled LG my family had purchased, but it is DEFINITELY the last.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: Eddie Flores
Reviews.Content: So far its been a great phone but from what I can tell it has some issues switching from 3G to Wifi, Not a big deal to me but could be an issue for some. Half of the time it's easier to just turn wifi off and use 3G even at home.

Reviews.Title: More phones should be made this tough!
Reviews.Author: Gadget Geek
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone at Wal-Mart to use with the StraightTalk prepaid plan.  I had the phone a month when my 2-year-old threw it in the pool.  I immediately took it apart and my husband put it in the dryer on a sweater rack.  I am still using the phone almost a year later!  I bought a second phone just like it for my husband to use.  This time my 2-year-old jumped in the pool without his water wings (I was standing right beside him, fully clothed with my phone in my pocket)...of course, I jumped right in and got him out.  AGAIN, I immediately took the phone apart and put it in the dryer on a sweater rack...the phone still worked.  THEN, my husband put the phone on the bumper of his truck and drove over top of it...the phone still worked!...the screen was cracked and you couldn't see much of what you were typing, but the phone still worked...and the screen worked too!  I wish all phones were made with the quality of this phone!  When we replaced the phone that had been run over, we were sad to find out that this phone was no longer offered with the StraightTalk plan.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Therese Boehlert
Reviews.Content: I have had this phone for several months and I love it.  Battery life is excellent, charges from 50% to full charge in less than one hour. Plenty of apps available.

Reviews.Title: pictures were lost 3 times now
Reviews.Author: dlinrich
Reviews.Content: I have had my phone for almost a year and within that time my pictures were totally gone for no reason. sooo frustrating! Otherwise I like the phone and camera. Good price with Straight Talk from Wal-Mart.

Reviews.Title: One of the best phones from Straight Talk!
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: This phone is great, never had one problem with the touch buttons or lock button. The screen is good size not too big not too small, and has crisp graphics. The speaker is amazing, the over feel of this phone is nice but I do highly recommend a case and screen protector. Battery life is way better than my previous phones (Samsung Galaxy S2, & HTC One). I've had this phone for four months now and only have one complaint, at times it is a bit slow but nothing too horrible. I clean my phone out often to keep it running its best deleting messages calls and unneeded pictures. There is an amazing app called Clean Master it works great to get rid of junk that slows your phone down. This phone is great I recommend it and you can't go wrong with the Verizon towers it uses super fast at times the 3g blows my wifi out of the water! You can't go wrong with this phone, I would however go with the Samsung Galaxy S3 (Verizon tower model) if you have the extra cash. I ordered this online and it came unavailable due to high demand. I drove 140 miles to get this phone from a Walmart store I paid $200.00 brand new and got the protection plan as well. I have cracked a small portion of the screen down by the touch buttons but I don't notice it, I happened to take my case off that day just to feel the phone in it's natural state lol than I dropped it. Get a case!!! Can't go wrong with this phone Straight talk has a bunch of junk phones running on ancient android versions. This one I believe is Ice Cream Sandwhich which has not bothered me at all my S2 was updated with Jelly Bean which is nice but I didn't notice a difference to be honest! So yes if you are interested in this phone go for it!!!

Reviews.Title: LG Optimus Showtime Android Prepaid Phone (Net10)
Reviews.Author: vital
Reviews.Content: I got this in October 2013 from amazon at $199.30 Looked for a phone and decided to look for one on amazon. after reading reviews for this phone I wanted to give it a try. So far i'm happy I got it.screen is responsive and does what you tell it to do.it is no 1080p it is 720p. it has front and back cameras.charger is a usb one. battery life is a whole day long, not more.speakers give a good volume.phone is fast, never froze on me yet.tons of applications and settings to play with or to adjust your phone the way u like it.if u will go to Verizon to have it activate it, Verizon will not do it, they will say that this phone is not compatible with their network, so u will need to use net10 service, u can buy it at Wal-Mart.

Reviews.Title: Great phone, Verizon Service
Reviews.Author: mukimali
Reviews.Content: I've had a smart phone for about a year with Net10 but it is a very basic model and is slow, and you are limited with how much you can install on it. I also would get no reception in my office (using Sprint towers). When I saw this phone for $179, I know I would upgrade.The phone is fantastic, the display is large enough to surf the web and do all you'd need to do on a tablet, yet small enough to fit in your pocket. The screen is super sharp, very nice display. Very quick 3G and the service is through Verizon, so you are basically getting a Verizon Smartphone for $45 a month. Android 4.0 is wonderful, everything moves super fast even without using a wireless network. Plenty of memory to install everything you need. The phone itself is thin and sleek. Camera quality is OK, it has a zoom (digital) and a flash. Very easy transfer of all info from other android phone (contacts, email, calendar). Transferring the number through Net 10 (from one Net10 phone to another) can be done online and took 10 minutes.Cons - the built in speaker sounds bad, at full volume it is over saturated, reducing volume helps a bit.Battery life is short, but this is not different from my other smart phone, I charge it overnight and with a task killer, usually am at ~25% at the end of the day.Overall a great deal for the money and can't beat Verizon coverage. I've tried the Samsung Galaxy SII and this one is right about at the same level. Personally I prefer LG phones to Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: celestine bacio
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied with this product. Has everything I expected in this phone. Only problem have is photos being backed up someplace else. Would prefer it stays on my photo app.

Reviews.Title: Great phone for the price!
Reviews.Author: Seneschal
Reviews.Content: This is a great phone with a large 4.3" screen.  It's a good replacement from my previous Samsung Proclaim, which was also a good phone.  Best part is to be on the Net10-branded Verizon cell network which uses Verizon towers, as Verizon is the only cell phone provider with towers near my house.  Screen is bright and brilliant, and fast and easy to use.  Highly recommended.  Do try, however, to stay away from having to call the Net10 customer service though, they are the worst.  But as long as you can avoid that, this is a great deal for about $40-45 a month, pretty much half the price of getting the same thing through Verizon directly.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: KLP "electronic_lover"
Reviews.Content: I really liked this phone. It was the best android phone that I had ever owned. I'd had it about 4 months and it was working fine. Then on Christmas it died because of me neglecting to charge it all day. Well when I arrived back at home I charged it about 2 hours later. Usually I can turn it back on as long as it's charging but this time it got stuck on the loading screen, the blue one you see when turning on any Net 10 phone. I tried letting it charge fully, taking out the battery, and rebooting it but nothing fixed the problem. It stayed blue for hours. I had to get a new phone. Not what I was hoping for.

Reviews.Title: meh
Reviews.Author: Louie
Reviews.Content: this is an all around good phone and probably the best as far as ease of activation on the net10 network. the bring your own phone program is a joke. anyhow iv had this phone for a little over 3 months and will be purchasing a second as soon as i finish this review. my only problem with the phone is that the screen is EXTREMELY fragile compared to other phones of comparable value. the button centered in the digitizer is a very weak point. one fall from bathroom counter high and it was splinters. luckily a new digitizer can be had on amazon for about $25. however thanks to the madness that is LG model numbers finding a replacement LCD is next to imposable. im staring at an identical screen with identical connections and no luck. invest in a sturdy case. could have saved myself 100s with a $20 case from the get go. still a great phone though, better luck with number 2 i hope!!EDIT: on second though.... "ships in 2-4 weeks" no thanks....

Reviews.Title: Meets the needs
Reviews.Author: Joyce Kildahl
Reviews.Content: Purchased as a gift to upgrade phone from flip phone. It has not been activated yet, so experience is small

ProductInfo.Features:
Front Facing Camera,
4GB MicroSD Card (preinstalled)
5MP Camera/Video Recorder with Flash
3G/Wifi Connectivity
1 GHz processor
Android 4.0; 4.3" Touchscreen
Net10 Service
The item is non-returnable
ProductInfo.Name: LG Optimus Showtime Android Prepaid Phone (Net10)
